Client

Class ClientTextSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • Client.ClientTextSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientTextSocket
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class manages text communications with the server. This class is responsible for sending text messages to the server and relaying received messages to the text viewer component.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.io.DataInputStream dIn
      DataInputStream to read data sent from the server to this socket.
      private java.io.DataOutputStream dOut
      DataOutputStream to send data from this socket to the server.
      private boolean open
      Sentinel variable for the main loop of this thread.
      private java.net.Socket socket
      Socket to connect to the main server.
      private static int TEXT_SERVER_PORT
      The port number of the text server.
      private TextViewer textView
      TextViewer component used in the main window.
      protected java.lang.String username
      Username appended to the beginning of every message sent from this socket.
      private boolean valid
      State of the connection.

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        MAX_PRIORITY, MIN_PRIORITY, NORM_PRIORITY

    • Field Detail

      • TEXT_SERVER_PORT

        private static final int TEXT_SERVER_PORT
        The port number of the text server. This MUST be the same as the server's!

        TO DO: make this a part of a class specifically for constants.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • open

        private boolean open
        Sentinel variable for the main loop of this thread. When set to false, the socket will close after receiving the next message.

      • valid

        private boolean valid
        State of the connection. Set to true if and only if the socket successfully connects to the server. Otherwise, this is false.

      • socket

        private java.net.Socket socket
        Socket to connect to the main server.

      • dIn

        private java.io.DataInputStream dIn
        DataInputStream to read data sent from the server to this socket.

      • dOut

        private java.io.DataOutputStream dOut
        DataOutputStream to send data from this socket to the server.

      • textView

        private TextViewer textView
        TextViewer component used in the main window. All text received from the server is passed here.

      • username

        protected java.lang.String username
        Username appended to the beginning of every message sent from this socket.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientTextSocket

        public ClientTextSocket(java.lang.String addr)
        Initialize the socket by attempting to connect to the server and creating data streams. This constructor also sets open and valid to true unless an error occurs in connecting to the server or creating the data streams. If no errors occur, this constructor will also ask for a username.
        Parameters:
        addr - The IP address to connect to

    • Method Detail

      • getUserName

        private void getUserName()
        Asks the user for a username and sets open to that string.

      • setViewer

        public void setViewer(TextViewer tv)
        Sets textView.
        Parameters:
        tv - The textViewer object to print messages to

      • run

        public void run()
        Main loop to get messages from the server and relay them to the textViewer.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String s)
        Sends a message to the server.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to be sent

      • close

        public void close()
        Shuts down the server by sending a disconnect message and setting open to false.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Returns valid. This is true if and only if the connection to the server was successfully established. Otherwise, this returns false.
        Returns:
        The value of valid
